parameters.name: BundleId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bundle for the pool.

parameters.name: DirectoryId
parameters.description: The identifier of the directory for the pool.

parameters.name: Capacity
parameters.description: The user capacity of the pool. The desired number of user sessions for the WorkSpaces in the pool.

nested_params.name: DesiredUserSessions
nested_params.description: The desired number of user sessions for the WorkSpaces in the pool.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags for the pool. (dict) --- Describes a tag. The key of the tag. Value (string) --- The value of the tag.

parameters.name: ApplicationSettings
parameters.description: Indicates the application settings of the pool. Enables or disables persistent application settings for users during their pool sessions. SettingsGroup (string) --- The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. You can allow the same persistent application settings to be used across multiple pools by specifying the same settings group for each pool.

nested_params.name: Status
nested_params.description: Enables or disables persistent application settings for users during their pool sessions.

nested_params.name: SettingsGroup
nested_params.description: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. You can allow the same persistent application settings to be used across multiple pools by specifying the same settings group for each pool.

parameters.name: TimeoutSettings
parameters.description: Indicates the timeout settings of the pool. DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds (integer) --- Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within the time set, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance. IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds (integer) --- The amount of time in seconds a connection will stay active while idle. MaxUserDurationInSeconds (integer) --- Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session can remain active. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

nested_params.name: DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds
nested_params.description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within the time set, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance.

nested_params.name: IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds
nested_params.description: The amount of time in seconds a connection will stay active while idle.

nested_params.name: MaxUserDurationInSeconds
nested_params.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session can remain active. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

nested_items.name: WorkspacesPool
nested_items.description: Indicates the pool to create.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The identifier of a pool.

nested_items.name: PoolArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the pool.

nested_items.name: CapacityStatus
nested_items.description: The capacity status for the pool.

nested_items.name: AvailableUserSessions
nested_items.description: The number of user sessions currently available for streaming from your pool.

nested_items.name: DesiredUserSessions
nested_items.description: The total number of sessions slots that are either running or pending. This represents the total number of concurrent streaming sessions your pool can support in a steady state.

nested_items.name: ActualUserSessions
nested_items.description: The total number of user sessions that are available for streaming or are currently streaming in your pool.

nested_items.name: ActiveUserSessions
nested_items.description: The number of user sessions currently being used for your pool.

nested_items.name: PoolName
nested_items.description: The name of the pool.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the pool.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the pool.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time the pool was created.

nested_items.name: BundleId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the bundle used by the pool.

nested_items.name: DirectoryId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the directory used by the pool.

nested_items.name: Errors
nested_items.description: The pool errors.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: ApplicationSettings
nested_items.description: The persistent application settings for users of the pool.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Specifies whether persistent application settings are enabled for users during their pool sessions.

nested_items.name: SettingsGroup
nested_items.description: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. When persistent application settings are enabled for the first time for an account in an Amazon Web Services Region, an S3 bucket is created. The bucket is unique to the Amazon Web Services account and the Region.

nested_items.name: TimeoutSettings
nested_items.description: The amount of time that a pool session remains active after users disconnect. If they try to reconnect to the pool session after a disconnection or network interruption within this time interval, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new pool instance.

nested_items.name: DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If users try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within the time set, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance.

nested_items.name: IdleDisconnectTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The amount of time in seconds a connection will stay active while idle.

nested_items.name: MaxUserDurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a streaming session can remain active. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected. After this time elapses, the instance is terminated and replaced by a new instance.

nested_items.name: RunningMode
nested_items.description: The running mode of the pool.
